author: Imran Gowhar
text:
A Facebook profile picture of the accused helped the Bengaluru police crack the murder of 31-year-old techie Kusum Rani Singla, who was working with IBM.

The accused, Sukhbir Singh, a 30-year-old unemployed software engineer, was nabbed on Thursday after the police established his identity by matching the CCTV grab retrieved from Kusum’s apartment along with the Facebook profile picture through Kusum’s friends’ list.

Police tracked him to his hometown Mandakoula in Gurgaon, Haryana.

Investigations reveal that Sukhbir killed Kusum, after she developed cold feet on getting married to him as she realised that he was unemployed.

At her apartment, Sukhbir demanded money from her, which Kusum refused. In a fit of rage, Sukhbir attacked Kusum with a pen, stabbing her on the eyebrow, and strangled her to death using a laptop charger, police said. Sukhbir took her credit and debit card, mobile phone and cheque book before escaping.

Additional Commissioner of Police P. Harishekharan who supervised the investigations said after the murder came to light on Wednesday, the police obtained CCTV footage and cross checked his picture with the Facebook account.

Sukhbir met Kusum on Facebook in December 2015. He had seen her profile on a matrimonial website and sent a request on December 31 that Kusum accepted. On January 9, they exchanged their phone numbers and started talking to each other.
title: Facebook friend held for Bengaluru techie’s murder
